instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
I have this board which had quite some liquid damage and was molested by another shop before. Since it is not too busy I decided to give it a try. I replaced all missing IC and cleaned it. I got PPBUS at 12.56v and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> on L7560, on L7520 0v. Looking at <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>, I got 3.42v on pin 12. <SIGNAL>P5VS3_EN</SIGNAL> comes up high for a split second when connecting the charger and then drops to 0. I have on <CAPACITOR>C7524</CAPACITOR> 4.8v on pin 1 and 0v on pin 2. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> is present on <CAPACITOR>C7505</CAPACITOR> and 12.56v on VIN. Ideas?

EDIT: green and orange light on charger

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>P5VS3_EN</SIGNAL> comes up high for a split second when connecting the charger and then drops to 0"
Any pulse at L7520 at the same moment?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <SIGNAL>P5VS3_EN</SIGNAL> came up for a split second on Pin 4 at 3.3v. L7520 pulsed as well, once i saw 5v but after a few tries 3v. I think it might just not be long enough of a pulse to show 5v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> pulsing too?
No pulse at all on VCORE?
